FacilityName: City of Santa Maria Blending Station
ParentCompanyName: City of Santa Maria Utilities Department
DeregistrationReasonOtherText: Source never had an inventory of a regulated substance.

_emerg_resp.FR_OtherRegulation: CA Code of Regulations (CCR) Title 19, Section 2770.5; CA Health & Safety code (H&SC), Section 25534

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan for the following chemical inventory:

Ammonia - 7,000 gallons



Site also includes:

Bleach - 10,000 gallons

Fluorosilicic Acid -4,800 gallons



There are no full time on-site personnel or emergency response team. The City of Santa Maria Fire Department is our initial response to a hazardous materials spill or incident.



The City of Santa Maria Fire Department has their specialized training for their specific jobs and would respond to a hazardous spill or incident. The City of Santa Maria has several Utilities Department staff members who have 40-hour HAZWOPER training for handling an incident involving hazardous materials. These employees have 8-hour annual refresher course training. The classes are designed to comply with mandated federal and/or state HAZWOPER general site worker training requirements. 



If City staff is inable to handle an event, then the Santa Barbara County Fire Department, Hazardous Materials Unit, would become the lead agency.



The following actions shall be taken in the event of an emergency. The general public on the streets shall be cleared from the area of an explosion, fire or hazardous materials release. There are two available exits leaving to Fairview Drive from the facility. Staff during occupancy on site will have cell phones and two-way truck radios as a back-up communications to be used to contact the fire department and medical assistance in the event of an emergency or injury. The site staff shall remain at a safe distance from the facility until it has been determined it is safe to reenter the facility by the fire department. There is a stationary back up power generator, so a loss of power would not be an issue.



The Water Resources Lead Operator for that day shall act as the City emergency coordinator and direct the response activities. The facility will be caution coned-off or yellow caution tape will be used to indicate no entry by un-authorized personnel. Authorized site personnel shall w

ear appropriate PPE, including respirators, as necessary before approaching the impacted area. Liquid hazardous material spill cleanup measures shall begin with the application of non-combustible absorbent materials placed around the perimeter of the spill area. Absorbent material shall be carefully applied to the impacted area until absorption is complete. Once absorption is complete, the spent absorbent material shall be containerized and stored with the appropriate compatible waste group. Release of a solid hazardous material shall be cleaned by sweeping the material directly into a compatible waste group. 



MSDS sheets are available by contacting the 3E Company, 1-800-451-8346, 1-760-602-8703, or www.3ECompany.com.

The Business Plan is located on-site in the Blending Station Generator Room or at the Utilities Department, in the Regulatory Compliance Supervisor's office (805-925-0951, x7241).
